etymology.description: semantic: 手 “hand” + phonetic: 毄 (jī); 毄/𬆦 also means “to strike, to ram.”
etymology.interpretation: Hand indicates a manual action, while 毄 provides the sound jī. Because 毄 itself carries the idea of ramming or hitting, the combined graph naturally expresses striking with the hand.
etymology.simplification: Simplified in the PRC to 击 by adopting a long-used handwritten/abbreviated form and removing the complex 手 + 毄 structure, greatly reducing strokes while preserving the reading jī.

examples.chinese: 他用拳猛击对手(他用拳猛擊對手)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng quán měng jī duìshǒu.

examples.chinese: 他击中目标(他擊中目標)。
警察迅速出击(警察迅速出擊)，逮捕嫌犯(逮捕嫌犯)。
examples.english: The police quickly launched an attack and arrested the suspect.
